DOC.brief_summary: A double-blind clinical trial investigate sub-group functional dyspeptic patient without use NSAID gastric erosion could better evolution dyspeptic symptom Helicobacter eradication placebo control group
DOC.detailed_description: Objective : investigate sub-group functional dyspeptic patient without use NSAID gastric erosion could better evolution dyspeptic symptom Helicobacter eradication placebo control group Design : A randomized double-blind placebo control clinical trial Inclusion Criteria : Patients 18 year , Functional dyspepsia accordingly Rome III criterion , Helicobacter pylori infection two diagnostic test Exclusion Criteria : No concordance inform consent ; Pregnant woman breast feed trust anticonceptional method ; Structural gastrointestinal abnormality except gastritis , duodenitis hiatal hernia ; Previous treatment Helicobacter pylorus infection ; Previous surgery esophagus , stomach duodenum ; Hypersensitivity drug study ; Proton pump inhibitor use previous 15 day ; H2-antagonists use previous 07 day ; Antibiotics use previous 30 day ; Patients unable answer study questionnaire ; Alcohol abuse ; Drug use ; Serious comorbidities ; Biliary colic ; Irritable bowel syndrome ; Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease Interventions : amoxicillin , clarythromycin , omeprazole 10 day Control : Placebo Outcomes : Primary : Proportion patient 50 % reduction baseline symptom score measure validated Porto Alegre Dyspeptic Symptoms Questionnaire Secondary : Proportion patient 100 % reduction baseline symptom score measure validated Porto Alegre Dyspeptic Symptoms Questionnaire ; Need rescue medication ; Median difference score group ; Mean SF-36 score evolution group ; Lost productivity measure WPAI group Visits : screening , baseline , 4 , 8 , 12 month Endoscopic evaluation : screening , 12 month Helicobacter detection method : urease , histology ( 3 pathologist ) perform screen 12 month
